text: HTML pages viewed in the embedded browser can use a special JavaScript object to interact with Houdini.
The Houdini embedded web browser provides a bridge for executing Python and HOM code from JavaScript.
The method for calling Python from Javascript code changed in Houdini 16 due to Houdini switching to the Qt5 UI library. Scripts written to use the
object will need to be rewritten to initialize the bridge and use the asynchronous callback style for expressions.
When you view a page in the embedded browser, the JavaScript on that page can use the
JavaScript object to execute Python code and interact with Houdini.
This only works in the embedded browser
This lets you set up HTML interfaces that can read information from and change the Houdini scene.

Unlike the Qt4 version, calls to the Javascript bridge in Qt5 are
: they return immediately instead of waiting until the Python code runs. To get the result of a Python expression, you need to register a callback function.
